main event: A bright flash was observed in the sky east of the Hawaiian Islands, believed to be caused by the entry of a meteor into the Earth's atmosphere.
interesting points: The flash was observed by military personnel and was estimated to have occurred at an altitude of 55-60 thousand feet.
One observer believed the flash was caused by a meteor.
A co-pilot on a separate flight also observed a bright white illumination behind clouds below 8,000 feet, which was also evaluated as a probable meteor.
The sightings were reported and evaluated as part of Project Blue Book, the U.S. Air Force's historical program to investigate UFO reports.
The reports mention CIRVIS (Celestial Incident Reporting System) evaluations, indicating the sightings were documented and analyzed by military authorities.
